intro: Eriogonum shockleyi subsp. typicum, commonly known as the Shockley’s buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is part of the Polygonaceae family and is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
